channel.title: [Java] Pixel Grabbing/Image Searching
channel.description:
How would an image search work with different screen sizes, different resolutions, different color settings, etc?
I really need to be able to search a screen for an image and get the location of it, but it needs to be compatible with everything stated above.
Any ideas?

item.title: [Java] Pixel Grabbing/Image Searching
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Random idea, not exactly sure how picture data is stored, but…
What if you took the lines of data from the image and compared it to different lines on the screen? Such as:

00011000
00011000
00011000
00011000
00011000
00011000

1=image pixel

0000101010000000000000011000
0000101010000000000000011000
0000101010000000000000011000
0000101010000000000000011000
0000101010000000000000011000
0000101010000000000000011000

(Just using binary as an example, I don’t mean actually using binary for data storage.)
As you can see, the theoretical ‘image’ from the first block of code is found on the right side of the second section of data.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Pixel Grabbing/Image Searching
item.dc:creator: @SnowBoarder7 SnowBoarder7
item.description:
@SnowBoarder7 wrote:

Something like that, something to do my work for me ;D, but if I get a different monitor/give it to a friend/wanna release I want it to be compatible with everything/almost everything.

My condolences to your grandpa, David.

Read full topic
